direction.raw_text: is blaring, but here it's only a whisper with a beat. Water trickles out of a jagged pipe. Splashing up mud, the riverlet weaves through hamburger wrappers and sunbleached beer cans, spent condoms and an old Spin magazine. The tiny stream ripples past glass and trash and the body of a woman. Face up, breathing. Dead grass caught in her braids. Her name is RONNA MARTIN. She's eighteen and bleeding. Bleeding a lot. She tries to         push herself up, but the dirt around her crumbles. Her legs are         useless. Despite it all, there's a smile of perverse joy         to her face, like she's just remembered the punchline to         a favorite joke.

direction.raw_text: Adam stops at a payphone. A long moment before he reaches for the receiver. With a breath, he dials 911.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emergen... He hangs up. 152   EXT. GAS STATION ISLAND - NIGHT (RAIN)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zack dunks the squeegee back in the bucket. With a wad of paper towels, he cleans the hood of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Washing his face, Adam looks at his reflection in the scratched mirror. He steps to the urinal, unbuttons. Before he can start to piss, he notices something strange. He looks down at his crotch. 154   EXT. GAS STATION ISLAND - NIGHT (RAIN)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zack throws away the last of the towels as Adam approaches. With a finger to his lips, Adam holds out a mess of tape and wires, all connected to a battery pack. It's the microphone he was wearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy sh... He stops himself. Adam throws the bundle as far as he can. They keep their voices low anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They wouldn't have been listening all this time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, they could have been recording it. Everything we said could be on tape somewhere. They would know we did it. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if we were just running lines? For a scene? Adam won't even dignify that with an answer. A long moment, just the BUZZ of the lights overhead. With an almost eerie calm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a pretty good chance no one's found her yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They will. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Listen. If there's no body, there's no crime. 155   EXT. FIELD - NIGHT (RAIN)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Supafest is still RAGING in the distance. Adam digs through the trunk of the convertible, frantically rearranging the junk inside. He keeps looking around the lid, waiting for someone to sneak up on them. Zack watches Adam's fruitless arranging efforts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop. Okay, stop!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a Miata. All Adam's effort, he's made enough room for a pizza. Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll put her in the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where will I...Or you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the passenger seat. Holding her up. Adam shudders at the thought. With a flashlight, Zack jumps down into the ditch. He nudges Ronna's body with his foot. She's dead alright. He rolls the body over, grabbing under her arms. He tries to hoist her up, but she's too heavy and the ditch is too deep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do this. Frustrated, Zack tries again to lug the body out. He can't do it by himself. Meanwhile, Adam is starting to hyperventilate, tears swelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, listen to me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dead. I hit her and I killed her. He looks around, expecting someone to walk up and see them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you didn't, okay? This is all just make-believe. This is a scene. She's just acting dead. And you're just acting scared. Adam laughs to himself, still crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, there's the lights, and there's the camera. Watch your blocking. (pointing) There's Michelle in wardrobe, say "Hi, Michelle!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Michelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The craft service truck is right around the corner, and they have lots of little veggie burgers on the grill. And you can have one if you just help me finish this scene. (sniffing) Can you smell them? Can you smell them on the grill? A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not delusional. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then take her fucking arms! Obeying, Adam grabs Ronna's wrists as Zack pushes from below. Together they get the body out of the ditch. Zack climbs up to help maneuver her into the car. Just then... Ronna MOANS. Adam freaks out, dropping his side. Ronna's head hits the dirt. Louder MOANING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No shit! They stand back, watching Ronna MOAN as she lies half-in, half- out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she's not dead, that means we didn't kill her. We can just leave her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's almost dead. We leave her and she dies, why did we bother coming back? I mean, you still killed her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, I killed her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, I didn't mean it that way. C'mon. I would never testify against you. Adam is not reassured.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to stick with Plan A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Plan A she was dead. Zack reaches into the car, pulling out The Club. Trades a look with Adam, who finally acquieces. Almost says something, doesn't. They both look around, making sure no one's coming. Zack grips the bar like a baseball bat. Adam turns his back, covering his ears. Zack raises the bar. Adam scrunches his face tight. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zack takes two quick breaths. And holds. And holds. And holds. Adam opens his eyes, looks back. Zack isn't swinging. He lowers the bar. They both breathe again, relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. New plan. 156   EXT. PARKING LOT - NIGHT (RAIN)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drones incessantly, the siren interrupted with an occasional
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back away from the vehicle. Weaving through some parked cars, we settle on an angry BMW, its lights flashing. A small throng of RAVERS have gathered around to look, because Ronna's limp body lies on the hood. A familiar face pushes through the crowd, just arrived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, it's Kelly. Somebody beat the crap out of her. Moving to find...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody call an ambulance! After a beat, he realizes he should do it himself. He takes off running. ADAM AND ZACK look around from the edge of a van in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, she's fine. They're getting an ambulance. She's fine. Adam keeps watching, not convinced. He turns back, a thought...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about that guy? The guy with the gun. He could still go after her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, listen. Girl in ditch -- that's our problem. Girl out of ditch -- that's her own problem. We're done. We did the right thing. Thunder RUMBLES overhead. Off Adam's look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, approximately the right thing. In a half-assed, thrown-together fashion. Adam smiles despite himself. Zack points, "See? See?" That just makes Adam smile more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home. As they walk off, we leave the Mary Xmas Supafest still BLARING in the distance. 157   INT. JAVAMAN CAFE / HOLLYWOOD - DAY                                     157 Too early for the brunch crowd, just a smattering of vampires. All around, Christmas lights are strung with mad abandon. The lights overhead FLICKER. Everyone looks up. That's when we come to find TODD GAINES sitting alone at a booth by the window, disassembling a newspaper. He finds the comics. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laying the paper flat, he tears off the bottom corner of the page and starts reading like a kid, his whole body leaning over the table. At the door, Claire comes in, shaking the rain out of her hair. After a beat, she does it again, as if she doesn't remember doing it the first time. She's tired and wired, all nerves and raw edges. There's static only she can feel. She looks right past Gaines, out to the rain on the street. He watches her, but doesn't try to catch her eye. The Jamaican WAITER walks past her with a pot of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anywhere you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm meeting people. He doesn't care. Claire takes a seat at the table in front of her, but it's not to her liking. Then a booth. She plays with the salt shakers. Bad. It's only now that she sees Gaines watching her. At first she doesn't recognize him. Then a light goes on. She climbs over the booth and into his, facing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're twins. She turns over his hand, compares it to hers. They both have the same ink stamp on the back. He's busted, no way to talk himself out. The Waiter comes with coffee, refills Gaines' cup. Claire overturns the cup in front of her. The Waiter fills it. She overturns a second cup, points to it. A big weird smile. Reluctantly, the Waiter fills that too. Then leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pay you back for breakfast. (leaning closer) Don't worry. I'm not really that hungry. She sheds her coat, having great difficulty with one sleeve. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen Ronna? Or Mannie? He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, when we go out, we always meet here afterwards in case we get separated. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It happens more than you'd think. I've been paging her, but she hasn't called back. The lights FLICKER again, storm still raging. Halfway into getting her coat off, Claire has second thoughts, but continues nonetheless. Gaines is taken off-balance, his private space violated. Claire finally looks up at Gaines, smiles. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless you wanted to eat alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's fine. 157A INT. CAFE - LATER                                                     157A Gaines scrapes the last of his eggs off the plate. Claire sits with two pieces of toast, untouched. She takes the scrap of the newspaper he tore off, looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you have against The Family Circus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's evil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Besides that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Location mostly. Bottom right corner, just waiting there to suck. It's the last thing you read, and it spoils everything you read before it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could just not read it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate it, yet I'm uncontrollably drawn to it. Are you going to... He points to her toast. She slides it over. He slathers on a thick coat of jelly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what I like about you? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm asking. I don't know. It's not your face, because you're only medium cute. I think what it is, is you might be the first non-fake person I've met here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professional curiousity. What are you on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ginseng and lotsa caffeine. Gaines leaves money for the check. A beat. Claire looks around at the various decorations: a red tree by the door, snowflakes on the window, lights blinking on the wall. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I like best about Christmas? The surprises. It's like, you get this box, and you're sure you know what's in it. You shake it, you weigh it, and you're totally convinced you have it pegged. No doubt in your mind. But then you open it up, and it's something completely different. Bing! Wow! Bang! Surprise! I mean, it's like you and me here. She smiles. She has a bewitching smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not saying this is anything it's not. But, c'mon. This time yesterday, who'dda thunk it? 158   INT. STAIRWELL TO GAINES' APARTMENT - DAY                             158 Claire kisses Gaines, pinning him against the wall. Rain BEATS against the door. She fumbles with his belt. His hand slides under her jacket, trying to undo her bra. They take a break from undressing to kiss harder. Reclining on the steps, Claire tries to push his jeans down with her toes. Her foot gets caught in the chain from his wallet. Her butt slides down a step. They laugh. Her hand hits something hard -- his gun. It's tucked into his jacket pocket. As they start to work up a rhythm, Huxley the cat comes down the steps, curious. He brushes against them, unnoticed. Finally, he MEWS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you get out? He looks to the top of the stairs, where a MAN is watching them. It's Victor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has the silver .45 drawn on them. Gaines looks down to the door at the bottom. Vic Jr. is blocking it. They're trapped. Claire looks around, trying to figure out what's happening. 159 - 167       OMIT                                                        159 - 167 167A INT. GAINES' LIVING ROOM - DAY                                             167A Gaines draws a map for Victor on the coffee table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon's apartment is around the back --                              * the gate's always open. Now, you're going to take Sunset to Hyperion.                                          * As he's talking, we MOVE to reveal Vic Jr. by the door, holding                   * the gun on them, and Claire, sitting on the couch beside Gaines.                                                                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At Hillhurst, you have to keep right --                              * you want Sunset Boulevard, not Sunset                                * Drive.                                                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just drive him there? Maybe                            * you could help pull the trigger.                                     * Gaines gives her a look. Victor takes the map and folds it.                       * He hands Gaines back his credit card. Just then, we hear a SOUND at the door -- a gentle KNOCK. All                     * eyes go to look.                                                                  * CLOSE ON the doorknob, someone trying it. It's unlocked. We                       * TILT UP to reveal the opener is actually...                                       * SIMON.                                                                            * He charges right into the room, shutting the door behind him.                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Todd, listen, I need hide out here. You                              * won't believe the shit we got into in...                             * He sees Victor. He immediately reaches for his gun, but                           * VIC JR. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is right behind him. He yanks Simon's gun away, then half-                         * pushes, half-carries him forward, slamming him down ONTO THE COFFEE TABLE.                                                             * Claire and Gaines both scoot back, freaked. Vic Sr. puts the                       * gun to Simon's head.                                                               * Panicked, Simon squirms, trying to look around. His face is                        * mushed against the glass.                                                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was your drive? We flew. Victor hands the gun off to Vic Jr., who rests it at the back                      * of Simon's head. Simon is moments away from execution.                             * All at once...                                                                     *
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Revisions (SALMON) 153   INT. GAS STATION BATHROOM - NIGHT (RAIN)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: * HeyHeyHey. Not here, not now.          Please no. God! Shit! I                    * This is so not where you want          don't wanna die.                           ** to be doing this.                                                                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it.                                                               * Vic Jr. COCKS the gun. Simon SQUEALS. At the last moment...                        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Stop! STOP! You can't do this!                                 * You won't get away with it!                                          * For a brief moment, she has their attention. She points to                         * herself.                                                                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, witness.                                                      * (re: Todd)                                                       * Witness. What are you going to do, kill                              * us too?                                                              * Gaines looks over, thanks for bringing that up. But Claire                         * still has the floor.                                                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is wrong with you people? Do you think this is an effective way of dealing with problems?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fuck shot my boy.                                               * (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * ...in the arm. Vic Jr. leans on him, shut up.                                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Victor) So, what? You're going to kill three                               * people?                                                            * (beat, no answer) What do you actually want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Justice. A look between all parties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. APARTMENT - LATER Sitting in the green chair, Simon makes an `X' on his bicep with a marker. He feels for the bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all flesh here, it should be okay. Gaines and the Vics stand around him. In the background, Claire is dubious and horrified. Vic Jr. puts Todd's gun to the `X.' Gaines hands Simon a shirt to mop up the blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, great. On some sick level, he's really into this. Vic Jr. gets ready to shoot. Everyone subtly backs away, bracing for the gunshot. Three. Two. One. But there's no bang.                                                         * Everyone looks at Vic Jr. He pulls the gun away.                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.                                                           * (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .                       * What do you mean you can't?           It's hard to shoot somebody              * (beat)                            who knows they're gonna be               ** You pull the fucking trigger.         shot. It's dif'rent.                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. Really.                                            * Claire rolls her eyes -- this is going to take forever. While                   * the Vic's argue, Claire grabs her coat and purse.                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?                                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta get to work.                                               * Todd doesn't want her to leave, but really, what can he say?                    * Everyone turns to watch Claire leave.                                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, now the girl's leaving.                                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you, Claire.                                                   * We follow her out the door. As she exits...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be good! In the background, the Vic Jr. is psyching himself up again.                    * INT. HALLWAY - DAY [CONTINUOUS] Claire shuts the door behind her. As she's headed for the steps, we hear a GUNSHOT. She flinches but keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm okay!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [See Scene 176] 169   INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY                                               169 Ronna wakes up, a bit at a time, an IV dripping overhead. We hear carolers SINGING in the distance. Her nose crinkles, her tongue finds her lips. Finally a swollen eye opens, looks around. A MEXICAN FAMILY is gathered around the other bed in the room, the father dressed as Santa Claus. Ronna sees the IV dangling from her arm. She sits up with difficulty, a head rush. She tries to get her bearings, but genuinely doesn't know how she got here. After a beat, she rips off the tape and carefuly pulls the needle out of her arm. 169A EXT. SUPERMARKET - DAY                                                 169A It's stopped raining, but the pavement is still wet. 169B INT. SUPERMARKET BREAK ROOM - DAY                                      169B Ronna slides her time card into the machine, which PUNCHES down. 169C INT. SUPERMARKET AISLE - DAY                                           169C Ronna ties her apron as she heads to the front, limping a bit. 169D INT. SUPERMARKET / CHECKOUT LANE - DAY                                 169D Claire finishes bagging groceries. Looks up to see Ronna coming to open the next register.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Claire doesn't say anything, a pointed silence. Ronna keys in, checks the drawer. Claire returns to her register. Ronna tries to make eye contact, but no luck. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, real mature. Claire continues to ignore her, turning her back. She straightens coupons, rubber-banding them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claire. Nothing. A beat. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Mistakes were made. Things didn't go exactly as planned. Claire's eyes -- understatement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it wasn't exactly a banner night for me, either. Claire stops, disbelieving -- if Ronna only knew. She turns on her, then back to the register, holding it in. But she just has to face her to say...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are constantly using us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Using you? You use me. Come on, if it weren't for me, you would be sitting home every night eating popcorn and watching reruns of 90210.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mannie is your chauffeur, and I am... (what is she?) I am some chick you leave sitting in an apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is such bullshit. Mannie does not feel that way. Ask him. Ask him! Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would I know? A beat. A cold horror crosses Ronna. Remaining calm... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drove you here, didn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I got a ride. His car was still in the parking lot when I left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit. Shit! Without even closing her register, she takes off her apron and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mannie? Mannie? Ronna limps ahead. A taxicab waits in the background. 171   EXT. A DIFFERENT ALLEY - DAY                                              171 CLAIRE Mannie! Mannie! All the alleys look the same. He could be anywhere. 172   EXT. BEHIND A DUMPSTER - DAY                                              172 A stray   black cat scratches through a pile of foam peanuts, looking   for bugs. Another cat crawls up the body of Mannie, propped   against the dumpster. A trickle of water drips off the garbage   onto his face. The cat licks it clean. Mannie smiles. 173   EXT. ALLEY INTERSECTION - DAY                                             173 RONNA Mannie! Can you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! Ronna turns to see Mannie behind her, stretching his neck. He's pale. His eyes are bloodshot. But otherwise, he's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like shit. 174   EXT. PARKING LOT - DAY                                                    174 The Beast is the only car left. Ronna and Claire circle, looking for the keys on the ground. Calling out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fucked Todd Gaines? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! (embarrased) We made out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kissed. A little. What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello! He's a drug dealer. Claire doesn't want this to go any further. Fortunately, just then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Found `em. She shakes the mud and grime off, then throws them to Ronna. Mannie lies back on the trunk, droopy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unlocking passenger door) You might have brain damage from overdosing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dain brambage? A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Xavier Kugat. Starts with X.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shit. She puts him in the car, holding his head like he's a criminal on "Cops."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll drive. Ronna hands her the keys over the roof of the Beast, sunlight shining off the gathered rain. They take a beat, just the two of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, do you have enough money to pay off your rent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And twenty left over. Maybe I'll open a savings account. GETTING IN... Claire starts the car. Mannie leans up from the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are we doing for New Year's? Ronna smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merry Christmas, Mannie. THE BEAST ROARS off across the parking lot, TITLE MUSIC building. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We PAN BACK to the rave hangar, heading for it, picking up speed. A MATCH CUT takes us to... 174A EXT. WAREHOUSE - NIGHT                                                 174A We HEAR a rave in full swing ahead. The hangar door is open, pitch black inside. We fly in, bringing us to... BLACK OUT. 117.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AFTER FIRST CREDITS FADE IN: 175   INT. SIMON'S APARTMENT - DAY                                                175 Simon awakes to POUNDING at the front door. He stands and turns, disoriented, no idea when or where he is. He finally finds a clock -- it's 4:14 in the afternoon. More POUNDING at the door. Simon half-crawls to the window, looking out to see who's at the door. HIS P.O.V. From this angle, all we can see is the sleeve of a man's jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it? He ducks, expecting a hail of gunfire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Todd. A beat, then Simon finally drops his panic. He keeps the gun in hand as he pulls the chair away from the doorknob and slowly undoes the lock. He leaves the chain on. Looking out through the crack, we see Gaines, alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Todd. Thank God. (undoes chain) You won't believe the shit I've been through... Without a word, Gaines grabs him by the collar and SMASHES him, one punch to the face. Simon falls in a dazed lump to the floor. We stay down with him as we watch Gaines walk away. Simon blinks and sniffles as we once again
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Zack scrub the Miata's upholstery with brushes and various cleaners, trying to get the bloodstains out. Zack stops for a moment, watching Adam. Adam looks up, what? Nothing. A quiet beat, the first moment of genuine affection between them. Suddenly we hear a BEEPING. We can't tell where it's coming from. Following the sound, Adam finds a mud-encrusted beeper wedged between the seat and the center console. He looks up to Zack, then checks the number.
direction.name: direction
